intro: Matelea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered matelea, is a species of flowering plant in the Apocynaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are usually opposite and ovate. Matelea parviflora is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers and is often found in rocky soils or along dry streambeds. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant.
